bedrockify.options.subCategory.bedrockOv: Configure the top left overlay and saving overlay.
bedrockify.options.subCategory.Reach-Aro: Place blocks in front of the block where you are standing.
bedrockify.options.loadingScreenChunkMap: Enables the Chunk Map Progress widget on loading screens.
bedrockify.options.recipes.tooltip: Must re-open world to apply changes.
bedrockify.options.reachAround.distance: Maximum Distance from the Block Border:
bedrockify.options.panoramaScreens: To access panorama screen configuration, please open Panorama Screens mod configuration through Mod Menu.
Position of the BedrockIfy Settings Button on the Game Options Screen. If disabled, you can access BedrockIfy settings through Mod Menu or by pressing B when a world is loaded.
bedrockify.options.pickupAnimations.tool: Enables the Bedrock Item HotBar Animations when picking, using, damaging items and tools.
bedrockify.options.toolbarStyle.tooltip: The item toolbar will be slightly transparent in Bedrock style.
bedrockify.options.bedrockShading.toolti: This includes the feature of Light Block Shading, Sunlight Glare and Sky Color Attenuation.
bedrockify.options.sunlightIntensity.too: The amount of sky color attenuation when looking at the sun. This is ignored when other shader mods are working.
bedrockify.options.fireAspectLight: Use Fire Aspect to light stuff:
bedrockify.options.fireAspectLight.toolt: Right-clicking on blocks like candles and tnt with a tool enchanted with Fire Aspect will light/prime them.
bedrockify.options.mixins.description:
In this category, you can Enable/Disable mixins for certain features. Disabling mixins will also disable their related features. Mixins can be disabled in order to improve compatibility with other mods.
Â§4Please do not change these settings unless you know what you are doing!
bedrockify.options.elytraStop.tooltip: Press space while flying with elytra to stop flying mid air.
bedrockify.options.bedrockCauldron.toolt: Toggles Bedrock Cauldron functionality, enabling cauldrons to hold tinted water and potions. Disabling this option won't remove cauldrons holding the new special liquids that already exist in the world.
bedrockify.loadingTips.1: Use seagrass to attract and breed turtles.
bedrockify.loadingTips.2: Protect baby turtles from hostile mobs!
bedrockify.loadingTips.3: Baby turtles will drop scutes when they grow - these can be crafted into turtle shells.
bedrockify.loadingTips.4: Use a bed to set your respawn point during the day.
bedrockify.loadingTips.5: Brew some water-breathing potions for underwater exploration!
bedrockify.loadingTips.6: Dolphins can lead you to shipwrecks and underwater ruins, feed them cod and follow their trail!
bedrockify.loadingTips.7: Use shears to carve a pumpkin.
bedrockify.loadingTips.8: Use phantom membranes to repair your elytra.
bedrockify.loadingTips.9: There are 3,587 types of tropical fish!
bedrockify.loadingTips.10: Sea pickles can be smelted into lime green dye.
bedrockify.loadingTips.11: Use hay bales to breed Llamas!
bedrockify.loadingTips.12: Compasses point to the world spawn - craft one to find your way back!
bedrockify.loadingTips.13: Trade with villagers to obtain food, tools and even treasure maps!
bedrockify.loadingTips.14: Did you know you can hold a map in your off-hand?
bedrockify.loadingTips.16: Sneak or wear frost-walker boots to walk safely on magma blocks.
bedrockify.loadingTips.17: You can gather cobwebs using shears.
bedrockify.loadingTips.18: Need diamonds? They get more common as you go deeper.
bedrockify.loadingTips.19: Before you mine diamonds, redstone or gold, make sure you're using an iron, diamond or netherite pickaxe or the ore won't drop.
bedrockify.loadingTips.20: Need coal for torches or fuel? Try smelting wood logs in a furnace to make charcoal!
bedrockify.loadingTips.21: Gold is more abundant in Badlands biomes!
bedrockify.loadingTips.22: Elytra can be used to glide, find them in End City ships!
bedrockify.loadingTips.24: Tridents are dropped by the Drowned, and can be held or thrown.
bedrockify.loadingTips.25: You can breed Hoglins with Crimson Fungus, but it is dangerous!
bedrockify.loadingTips.26: You can smelt 20 items in a furnace by using a block of dried kelp as fuel.
bedrockify.loadingTips.27: Creepers that are killed by skeletons' arrows have a chance of dropping music discs.
bedrockify.loadingTips.30: You can find skins to customise your experience in-game, or on select platforms use your own!
bedrockify.loadingTips.31: Texture packs change the way that blocks, items and even the menus look in game. Try them out!
bedrockify.loadingTips.37: Emerald ores are the rarest ores in Minecraft! They can only be found in mountains and meadows!
bedrockify.loadingTips.38: Taming a skeleton horse doesn't require a saddle.
bedrockify.loadingTips.40: Diorite, you either love it or hate it.
bedrockify.loadingTips.41: Phantoms are dangerous mobs that appear during the night. Make sure to sleep regularly!
bedrockify.loadingTips.42: Zombies turn into Drowned if they sink under water.
bedrockify.loadingTips.43: Minecraft Live takes place every year! Look out for the next one!
bedrockify.loadingTips.44: Using fireworks boosts elytra speed in mid air. Just... make sure they don't explode, otherwise it'll hurt BADLY!
bedrockify.loadingTips.45: Gold is most common in the Nether and Badlands biomes.
bedrockify.loadingTips.50: Riptide enchantment will propel you through the air in the rain.
bedrockify.loadingTips.51: Minecraft Live is a worldwide interactive live-streaming event. Grab your items and join the party!
bedrockify.loadingTips.53: The Beacon is a powerful item that can only be crafted with a nether star from the Wither!
bedrockify.loadingTips.55: Did you know that nether stars can't be destroyed by explosions?
bedrockify.loadingTips.56: When digging straight up, place a torch at your feet to break any sand or gravel that could potentially fall down on you.
bedrockify.loadingTips.58: Shear a Beehive or nest to get Honeycomb, use a Bottle to get honey.
bedrockify.loadingTips.59: Place a Campfire under a Beehive or nest to harvest honey peacefully. Your bees will thank you.
bedrockify.loadingTips.60: Respawning in the Nether requires a charged Respawn Anchor.
bedrockify.loadingTips.61: You can charge a Respawn Anchor with Glowstone.
